 Community Tested How to Create a Hotspot in Windows 10   
 In Windows 10, you can broadcast your WiFi, Ethernet, or cellular data connection as a Wi-Fi hotspot. This allows other devices to connect to it. This can be done through the Settings app. Read this article to learn how. 
 Steps Edit

 Open Settings .   Press the Start

on the lower-left hand side of the menu.

 2 
 Click or tap the
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a7\/Windowsnetwork.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a7\/Windowsnetwork.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760} 
 Network & Internet  section. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ef\/Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-3.png\/459px-Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-3.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ef\/Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-3.png\/759px-Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-3.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":339.94505494505,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":561.64835164835} 
 3 
 Select  Mobile hotspot  from the left pane. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d6\/Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-4.png\/459px-Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-4.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d6\/Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-4.png\/759px-Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":339.94505494505,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":561.64835164835} 
 4 
 Choose your settings. 
 Select which connection you want to share under "Share my Internet connection from". 
 Press the  Edit  button to change the hotspot's name and password. 
 "Turn on remotely" automatically turns on the hotspot if both devices (PC and that device) are Bluetooth-enabled. [1] 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c8\/Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-5.png\/459px-Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-5.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c8\/Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-5.png\/759px-Create-a-Hotspot-in-Windows-10-Step-5.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":339.94505494505,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":561.64835164835} 
 5 
 Toggle on
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0a\/Windows10switchon.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0a\/Windows10switchon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":217.89473684211,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":360} 
the slider next to "Share my Internet connection with other devices".  Other devices will now see your hotspot and connect to it provided the correct password is entered.

 Warnings Edit 
 Broadcasting your cellular data connection might cause your data to be used up if you're on a limited plan. Depending on your provider, you may need to pay extra for overages.
